articles.title: Live sports is the new ‘Moneyball’ for streaming, Morgan Stanley says
articles.content: Falling valuations of broadcast and sports networks are likely to spur a domino effect that will determine where people watch major sporting events over the next decade, according to a new report.

articles.title: 5 Hot Sector ETFs & Stocks to Play for Summer Season
articles.content: Sun's out! Find out how to make your ETF portfolio sizzle this summer with our guide to the hottest sectors.

articles.title: 2 Stocks to Watch From the Challenging Computer Industry
articles.content: The Computer - Mini Computers industry is suffering from waning demand for PC, massive supply-chain and logistical issues, and geopolitical challenges. However, the strong demand for enterprise devices bodes well for Apple (AAPL) and HP (HPQ).

articles.title: This Bud's for investors. Buy the stock even if Bud Light sales never recover, says analyst.
articles.content: The unloved parent of Bud Light, Anheuser Busch, is a buying opportunity, says Deutsche Bank, and that's even if sales of its top brand don't fully recover.

articles.title: Why Intel was the Dow's worst performer for a second day in a row
articles.content: Intel stock fell again on Wednesday, making it the worst performer on the Dow Jones Industrial Average for a second day in a row.

articles.title: Disney stock sentiment has 'deteriorated,' but this analyst says not all hope is lost
articles.content: Investors seem to be feeling the Walt Disney Co. magic less and less these days, according to an analyst.

articles.title: Intel's first major contract foundry customer still a mystery as analysts sift through presentation
articles.content: Intel ended Wednesday as the worst stock on the Dow Average again as analysts appeared disappointed a major customer for its third-party foundry was not named.
